During this time, the emperor during this period was .Nussbaum, "Go-Tsuchimikado Tennō," p. 265; Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). Annales des empereurs du Japon, pp. 352-353. ==Events of the Bunshō era== * 1466 (Bunshō 1): At Nara, Kinpusen-ji's Nio Gate (niomon) was built.Hvass, Svend M. (1999). Ise: Japan's Ise Shrines : Ancient Yet New, p. 1493. * 1466 (Bunshō 1, 1st month): Ashikaga Yoshimi, brother of the Shogun, was promoted to the second rank of the second class in the Imperial court hierarchy.Titsingh, p. 353. ==Related pages == * Muromachi period == References == == Other websites == * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Bunshō 1st 2nd 1466 1467 Preceded by: Kanshō Era or nengō: Bunshō Succeeded by: Ōnin Category:Japanese eras
title: Bunshō
